articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: UN chief says we are in an "era of global boiling" as July set to be world's warmest month on record.

articles.description: Speculation mounts that Mr Trump will soon be charged over efforts to overturn his 2020 election loss.
articles.title: Trump lawyers meet federal prosecutors in election probe

articles.description: Multiple major US cities are under heat advisories which are expected to extend into the weekend.
articles.title: Biden announces measures to tackle extreme heat

articles.description: The plants in Arizona are losing their limbs, collapsing and entirely transforming in shape.
articles.title: Even cacti struggle under extreme weather

articles.description: Could the tide be turning after the United States - a dominant force for so long - are held by the Netherlands at the Women's World Cup?
articles.title: Frustrated & misfiring - is USA dominance fading?

articles.description: The tech giant claims millions of people were sent a warning before the deadly earthquake earlier this year.
articles.title: Google alert failed to warn people of Turkey earthquake

articles.description: Ukrainian fencer Olga Kharlan is disqualified from the World Fencing Championships for refusing to shake hands with Russian Anna Smirnova.
articles.title: Ukraine's Kharlan disqualified for handshake refusal

articles.description: The security service says Sweden's image has been harmed abroad and security at home has worsened.
articles.title: Sweden's Quran burnings put freedom of expression law to test

articles.description: Alicia Navarro, 18, shows up at a police station in Montana more than 1,000 miles from her home.
articles.title: Girl missing for nearly four years walks into police station

articles.description: Witnesses testify to lawmakers about unidentified phenomena amid calls for openness.
articles.title: UFOs and aliens bring a divided US Congress together
